1.brief: secure; in a bad sense, haughty
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
to puncture, literally (to perforate, with more or less violence) or figuratively (to specify, designate, libel)
the first, in place, time, order or rank (specifically, a firstfruit)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

2.brief: to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
Calneh or Calno, a place in the Assyrian empire
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
a Pelishtite or inhabitant of Pelesheth

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
dominion, i.e. (abstractly) the estate (rule) or (concretely) the country (realm)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
properly, a cord (as twisted), i.e. (by implication) a boundary; by extension the territory inclosed
properly, a cord (as twisted), i.e. (by implication) a boundary; by extension the territory inclosed

3.brief: properly, to toss; figuratively, to exclude, i.e. banish, postpone, prohibit
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

to be or come (causatively, bring) near (for any purpose); euphemistically, to lie with a woman; as an enemy, to attack; religious to worship; causatively, to present; figuratively, to adduce an argument; by reversal, to stand back
properly, session; but used also concretely, an abode or locality
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain

4.brief: to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a bed (as extended) forsleeping or eating; by analogy, a sofa, litter or bier
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a ram (as full-grown and fat), including a battering-ram (as butting); hence, a meadow (as for sheep); also a pad or camel's saddle (as puffed out)
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
a (male) calf (as frisking round), especially one nearly grown (i.e. a steer)
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre

5.brief: to scatter words, i.e. prate (or hum)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
a skin-bag for liquids (from collapsing when empty); hence, a vase (as similar in shape when full); also a lyre (as having a body of like form)
David, the youngest son of Jesse

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
something prepared, i.e. any apparatus (as an implement, utensil, dress, vessel or weapon)

6.brief: the first, in place, time, order or rank (specifically, a firstfruit)
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness
to rub with oil, i.e. to anoint; by implication, to consecrate; also to paint
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a fracture, figuratively, ruin; specifically, a solution (of a dream)
Joseph, the name of seven Israelites

7.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
a cry, i.e. (of job), a revel

8.brief: to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)

9.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to jut over or exceed; by implication, to excel; (intransitively) to remain or be left; causatively, to leave, cause to abound, preserve
ten (as an accumulation to the extent of the digits)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill

10.brief: to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
(figuratively) to love; by implication, a love-token, lover, friend; specifically an uncle
to cremate, i.e. to be (near) of kin (such being privileged to kindle the pyre)
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to say (used with great latitude)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, the flank; but used only figuratively, the rear or recess
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to say (used with great latitude)
cessation, i.e. an end (especially of the earth); often used adverb, no further; also the ankle (in the dual), as being the extremity of the leg or foot
to say (used with great latitude)
to hush
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

11.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
properly, dripping to pieces, i.e. a ruin; also a dew-drop
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
abbreviated, i.e. diminutive, literally (in quantity, size or number) or figuratively (in age or importance)

12.brief: to run (for whatever reason, especially to rush)
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
beef cattle or an animal of the ox family of either gender (as used for plowing); collectively, a herd
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
a poisonous plant, probably the poppy (from its conspicuous head); generally poison (even of serpents)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
wormwood (regarded as poisonous, and therefore accursed)

13.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a horn (as projecting); by implication, a flask, cornet; by resemblance. an elephant's tooth (i.e. ivory), a corner (of the altar), a peak (of a mountain), a ray (of light); figuratively, power

14.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
properly, to press, i.e. (figuratively) to distress
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
a desert; especially (with the article prefix) the (generally) sterile valley of the Jordan and its continuation to the Red Sea
